lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/sid.Sid.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run sid.Sid.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Tests for the Event task model (Level 8 date/time formatting).

assertEquals("[E][ ] an event (from: Aug 30 2025 18:00, to: Aug 30 2025 20:00)", e.toString());
Event e = new Event("another event", start, end, false);
assertEquals("[E][ ] another event (from: Sep 01 2025, to: Sep 02 2025)", e.toString());
Event e = new Event("mixed event", start, end, false);
assertEquals("[E][ ] mixed event (from: Dec 30 2025, to: Dec 30 2025 15:45)", e.toString());
Event e = new Event("trip", start, end, false);
assertEquals("[E][X] trip (from: Sep 01 2025, to: Sep 02 2025)", e.toString());
assertEquals("[E][ ] trip (from: Sep 01 2025, to: Sep 02 2025)", e.toString());

REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist
REM delete output from previous run
REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
REM compare the output to the expected output
RED="$(tput setaf 1)"; GREEN="$(tput setaf 2)"; BOLD="$(tput bold)"; RESET="$(tput sgr0)"
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminate if error occurred
# run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to ACTUAL.TXT
# convert to UNIX format (fallback if dos2unix is missing)
tr -d '\r' < ACTUAL.TXT > ACTUAL.tmp && mv ACTUAL.tmp ACTUAL.TXT
tr -d '\r' < EXPECTED-UNIX.TXT > EXPECTED-UNIX.tmp && mv EXPECTED-UNIX.tmp EXPECTED-UNIX.TXT
# compare the output to the expected output
